meanings.definition: The branch of science that deals with the motion of fluids and the forces acting on solid bodies immersed in fluids.
meanings.sent1: Understanding hydrodynamics helps engineers design better boats.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use hydrodynamics to study how water moves in rivers.
meanings.sent3: The fish were discussing hydrodynamics at their underwater book club.
meanings.sent4: Her dance moves had the grace and fluidity of hydrodynamics.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the essence of hydrodynamics in the swirling paint on the canvas.

meanings.definition: The study of the behavior of fluids in motion.
meanings.sent1: Hydrodynamics explains why water flows downhill.
meanings.sent2: Students learn about hydrodynamics in their fluid mechanics class.
meanings.sent3: The tea leaves seemed to perform a dance, demonstrating hydrodynamics.
meanings.sent4: The wind whispered secrets of hydrodynamics through the trees.
meanings.sent5: The storm surged with the power of hydrodynamics, reshaping the coastline.
